pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Prime Minister Theresa May of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke today with Prime Minister Theresa May of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

Prime Minister May offered her condolences for the tragic shooting at the Centre culturel islamique de Québec in the Ste-Foy neighbourhood of the city of Québec.  The two leaders discussed the importance of promoting inclusion and diversity to counter all forms of radicalization.   They also reaffirmed their shared commitment to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), the G7 and the G20. 

The two leaders discussed their commitment to promoting progressive free trade and investment, including the timely ratification and implementation of the Canada-EU Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).
